ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing the "Yale" essay and understanding expectations for essays written at Yale; developed writing skills in a comfortable though rigorous environment; discussion skills; time management skills; learning how to write a research paper.

Ok, so there is a brief section of the course where you discuss how to make clear and contestable theses, but other than that, you really get what you give in this course.  Dr. Robinson is a great guy and gave me great feedback on how to improve my writing.  If you focus, you will learn how to write well in your own style.  Death to the five-paragraph essay!
I learned how to structure and plan essays.

This course has taught me a lot about writing. Not only about proper how to write but also why. I am coming out of this course confidence about my writing and the stuff I needed to practice to become a greater writer.
I learned how to craft personal voice in research papers and other essays.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Great course; ENGL 114 is well-taught, Professor Robinson organizes his readings well, and the workload is reasonable vis a vis essays and readings.

No weaknesses. Professor Robinson is amazing.

Strengths: Clear feedback, fascinating topics, and overall fun class to take.  The workload isnt too bad.  If you want an A, you can get one.

Weaknesses: One studentwho I will not name in the interest of making whoever evaluates these evaluations job easierdominated all class discussions by spouting absolute nonsense.  Dr. Robinson, bless his heart, put up with it (and even encouraged it at times), which I thought took away from what we could discuss as a class.
The review process teaches you to think and plan ahead.
This course's biggest strength was the professor's understanding of the student's feelings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
YES! Professor Robinson's section is a gem in the ENGL 114 sections, the material (especially the Supreme Court cases and the discussions of obscenity law) is fascinating, and Professor Robinson cares deeply about you and your learning. Engage with Professor Robinson in class, go to his office hours and learn more about him, the course, and his advice about writing. THIS IS A GREAT COURSE, AND A GREAT ENGL 114 specifically. TAKE IT! 

Professor Robinson has put together a great syllabus, will help you become a better writer, and will introduce you to the rigors of writing courses at Yale College. This is a great introduction to writing here, and Professor Robinson's sections are the best of the ENGL 114s.

Absolutely.  If I was stuck on a desert island and could only take one thing, I would take Dr. Timothy Robinson so we could discuss obscenity law at length and write some *bomb* papersin the sand presumable, as there would be nothing to write on.  Maybe we could stack rocks and make an exciting enough thesis for an overpassing plane to stop and save us.
Yes, it teaches you good writing principles.
Yes, it is a good introduction to college writing. It covers a wide range of different writers and writing styles and improves your writing.
I will recommend this course to every student who would like to improve his writing and way of thinking about the word challenges.
